title: Chera dynasty
summary: The Chera dynasty(or Cēra), IPA: [t͡ʃeːɾɐ], was one of the principal lineages in the early history of the present day state of Kerala and some parts of Tamil Nadu in southern India.[1] Together with the Cholas of Uraiyur and the Pandyas of Madurai, the early Cheras were known as one of the three major powers (muventar) of ancient Tamilakam [1] in the early centuries of the Common Era.[2][3]
